intro: Escobariopsis laui subsp. dasyacantha, commonly known as the stiff-bracted escobariopsis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and hairy stems. The plant features small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are linear to lanceolate, often with a rough texture. This subspecies is adapted to arid environments and is found in rocky or sandy soils in its native range.
